db:info.db:title: QKeyValueIterator Class
db:info.db:subtitle: template <typename Key, typename T, typename Iterator> class QKeyValueIterator

db:abstract.db:para: Iterator over the key/value pairs of an associative container.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: The QKeyValueIterator class provides an STL-style iterator for returning key/value pairs from associative containers like QHash and QMap. It supports the same API as the STL associative containers, i.e. getting a key/value pair when iterating through the container.
This will allow for better interoperability between QMap, QHash and friends and STL-style algorithms.

db:warning.db:para: Iterators on implicitly shared containers do not work exactly like STL-iterators. You should avoid copying a container while iterators are active on that container. For more information, read Implicit sharing iterator problem.

db:section.db:title: [explicit constexpr noexcept(...)] QKeyValueIterator::QKeyValueIterator(Iterator o)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a QKeyValueIterator on top of o.

db:section.db:title: Iterator QKeyValueIterator::base() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the underlying iterator this QKeyValueIterator is based on.

db:section.db:title: std::pair<Key, T> QKeyValueIterator::operator*() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the current entry as a pair.

db:section.db:title: QKeyValueIterator<Key, T, Iterator> &QKeyValueIterator::operator++()
db:section.db:para: The prefix ++ operator (++i) advances the iterator to the next item in the container and returns the iterator.

db:note.db:para: Advancing the iterator past its container's end() constitutes undefined behavior.

db:section.db:title: QKeyValueIterator<Key, T, Iterator> QKeyValueIterator::operator++(int)
db:section.db:para: The postfix ++ operator (i++) advances the iterator to the next item in the container and returns the iterator's prior value.

db:note.db:para: Advancing the iterator past its container's end() constitutes undefined behavior.

db:section.db:title: QKeyValueIterator<Key, T, Iterator> &QKeyValueIterator::operator--()
db:section.db:para: The prefix c{–} operator (--i) backs the iterator up to the previous item in the container and returns the iterator.

db:note.db:para: Backing up an iterator to before its container's begin() constitutes undefined behavior.

db:section.db:title: QKeyValueIterator<Key, T, Iterator> QKeyValueIterator::operator--(int)
db:section.db:para: The postfix c{–} operator (i--) backs the iterator up to the previous item in the container and returns the iterator's prior value.

db:note.db:para: Backing up an iterator to before its container's begin() constitutes undefined behavior.

db:section.db:title: QKeyValueIterator<Key, T, Iterator>::pointer QKeyValueIterator::operator->() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the current entry as a pointer-like object to the pair.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] bool operator!=(QKeyValueIterator<Key, T, Iterator> lhs, QKeyValueIterator<Key, T, Iterator> rhs)
db:section.db:para: Returns true if rhs points to a different item than lhs otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] bool operator==(QKeyValueIterator<Key, T, Iterator> lhs, QKeyValueIterator<Key, T, Iterator> rhs)
db:section.db:para: Returns true if rhs points to the same item as lhs otherwise returns false.
